title.narrative: Disaster Risk Management in Schools Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to increase the safety of students, teachers and staff in selected schools in high-risk seismic zones in Turkey.

condition.narrative: LA, Schedule 2, Section I.A.1. The Borrower, through MoNE, shall be responsible for the overall implementation, management,coordination and oversight of the Project, including, inter alia: (a) providing policy oversight, stewardship and working levelcoordination with concerned governmental agencies and regional authorities; (b) maintaining, within CRED, the ProjectImplementation Unit (PIU), under terms of reference, and with adequate staffing, and with qualifications and functions allacceptable to the Bank; and (c) ensuring that the PIU consistently (i) applies the requirements and procedures set forth in theProject Operations Manual (POM), (ii) carries out the procurement process, financial management and preparation of withdrawalapplications under the Project, and (iii) monitors and evaluates the progress of Project implementation in accordance withindicators agreed upon with the Bank.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.B.1 and 2. The Borrower, through MoNE, shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, a POM,acceptable to the Bank, and shall carry out the Project, or cause the Project to be carried out, in accordance with the POM,provided, however, that in case of any conflict between the POM and the provisions of the Loan Agreement, the provisions of theLoan Agreement shall prevail.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1. The Borrower, through MoNE, shall ensure that: (a) the Project is carried out in accordance withthe Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF); (b) prior to the issuance of the bidding documents for any workscontract, prepare and submit to the Bank for its approval the proposed design and site for the works and the Environmental andSocial Management Plan (ESMP), and the draft contract for such works; (c) any contractor carrying out civil works under the Projectshall perform such work in accordance with the technical and environmental practices applicable to the Project, as set forth in theESMF and ESMP(s), and under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience necessary to satisfactorily carry out thedesign and construction of the Project; (d) any contracts for civil works under the Project include Codes of Conduct acceptable tothe Bank; (e) all activities undertaken for the purpose of carrying out the Project comply with environmental standards andguidelines satisfactory to the Bank, as set forth in the ESMF, and in accordance with the ESMP(s); (f) all sites selected for thecarrying out of civil works under the Project shall involve no land acquisition that includes or may result in InvoluntaryResettlement, and be on land plots that are already in the legal possession of the Borrower, and neither involve nor will involveInvoluntary Resettlement; (g) the Bank is immediately informed of any circumstances that have arisen or that may arise concerningthe Borrower's legal possession of, or the possibility of Involuntary Resettlement on a proposed or selected site.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.2. The Borrower, through MoNE, shall ensure that the terms of reference for any consultancy in respectof any activity under the Project incorporate the requirements of the World Bank's Safeguard Policies then in force, as applied tothe advice conveyed through such technical assistance.

LA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.3. The Borrower, through MoNE, shall: (a) as soon as reasonably practicable, but no later than five(5) business days after the occurrence of a Significant Event, inform the Bank by any electronic means of the nature of theincident, accident, or circumstance and any effect or impact (whether on-site or off-site) resulting therefrom; (b) as soon asreasonably practicable, but no later than thirty (30) business days after such Significant Event, provide the Bank with a summaryreport that includes a description of such Significant Event, and the measures, if any, that the Borrower is taking or plans totake to address such Significant Event and to prevent any future similar event; and (c) keep the Bank informed of the on-goingimplementation of the said measures and plans.
